p:
Infectious nodes infect susceptible neighbors at a per contact rate of β
i , where i ∈ {seasonal, pandemic} indicates strain. We estimate β seasonal by fitting a seasonal transmission model to recent flu season data (see data and model fitting section), and consider three transmission rate scenarios for the pandemic virus (1) equal transmissibility ( β pandemic = β seasonal), (2) lower transmissibility ( β pandemic < β seasonal), and (3) higher transmissibility ( β pandemic > β seasonal).
